1.text: But Baldad the Suhite, responding, said:

2.text: How long will you speak this way, so that the words of your mouth are like a changeable wind?

3.text: Does God supplant judgment, or does the Almighty subvert that which is just?

4.text: And if now your children have sinned against him, and he has dismissed them into the power of their iniquity,

5.text: even so, you should arise early to God, so as to beseech the Almighty.

6.text: If you approach with purity and honesty, he will quickly be attentive to you, and a peaceful life will repay your righteousness,

7.text: so much so that, if your former things were small, your latter things would be multiplied greatly.

8.text: For inquire of the earliest generation, and investigate diligently the history of the fathers,

9.text: (of course, we are but of yesterday and are ignorant that our days on earth are like a shadow,)

10.text: and they will teach you; they will speak with you and will offer you the eloquence of their hearts.

11.text: Can the marsh plant live without moisture? Or can sedges grow without water?

12.text: When it is still in flower, and has not been pulled up by hand, it withers before all other plants.

13.text: Just so are the ways of all who forget God, and the hope of the hypocrite will perish.

14.text: His frenzy will not please him, and his faith will be like a spider’s web.

15.text: He will lean on his house, and it will not stand; he will prop it up, but it will not rise.

16.text: He seems to have moisture before the sun arrives; and at sunrise, his sprout shoots forth.

17.text: His roots will crowd together over a heap of stones, and among the stones he will remain.

18.text: If someone is devoured right beside him, he will deny him and will say: “I do not know you.”

19.text: For this is the benefit of his way, that others in turn may spring up from the earth.

20.text: God will not discard the simple, nor will he extend his hand to the spiteful,

21.text: even until your mouth is filled with laughter and your lips with rejoicing.

22.text: Those who hate you, will be clothed with confusion, and the tabernacle of the impious will not continue.
